medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 weeks ago, reported as RUQ abdominal pain and nausea with nonbloody emesis. The patient also experienced a fever. Nursing staff noted he communicated his pain three days prior to admission, but he has a poor concept of time. Patient reports inability to take more than liquids and diarrhea for some time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), Hyperlipidemia (HLD), bipolar disorder, anxiety, peripheral vascular disease (PVD), cellulitis of the right leg, left anterior fascicular block, ischemic tissue loss, mild mitral regurgitation. Past surgeries include left hand surgery, right femoral-tibial bypass, and right toe amputation.
medical_history.social_history: Patient resides in a nursing home. Full social history is not provided.
